summary: This bill, the United States Foreign Service Commemorative Coin Act, mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins to recognize the Foreign Service of the United States. It specifies coin denominations ($5 gold, $1 silver, and half-dollar clad), design requirements (emblematic of diplomacy and the Foreign Service), and issuance period (2029). Surcharges from coin sales will fund the Association for Diplomatic Studies and Training to support diplomatic history preservation and education. The bill also includes financial assurances to prevent net costs to the government.
